[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure Voting System (SVS) defines requirements for fast response, encrypted authentication, data security, and usability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SVS supports secure authentication, encrypted transactions, system monitoring, and a simple user experience.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SVS integrates with authentication, database encryption, and monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SVS provides a web-based and mobile UI for voters and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SVS runs on cloud-hosted, load-balanced servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SVS uses React.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and Redis caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SVS secures data with TLS 1.3 and SSL encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SVS optimizes performance for high-traffic response.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SVS manages authentication, monitoring, and security enforcement.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SVS connects to authentication, security monitoring, and logging APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SVS handles voter authentication, encrypted transactions, system security, and real-time monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SVS is designed for voters, election administrators, and security auditors.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SVS requires a stable internet connection for secure authentication and monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SVS relies on encryption, cloud hosting, and monitoring tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow voters to log in securely within 3 seconds (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall encrypt transactions using SSL.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store encrypted voter credentials.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall implement security challenges after failed logins.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall notify ECA users of system failures (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate SSL authentication and database security.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide real-time monitoring and alerts.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process login requests within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with ~4.38 hours per month downtime.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store voter data and system logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce strong password encryption.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with election security standards (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure uptime, threat detection, and security monitoring.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, encryption, security, and alerts validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, security policies, and API documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: Election security protocols, SSL encryption standards, and UI/UX best practices.
